seriesJson.title: What is modern poetry
seriesJson.description: This series presents lectures with readings of poems.  It strives to discuss and define modern poetry in a non-technical way.  Text is read by Professor Alan Simpson of the University of Chicago; poetry is read by members of University Radio Theatre.

node.title: Techniques of modern poetry
node.description: In this program, Professor Simpson analyzes a variety of then-current poetic techniques.

node.title: Themes and subjects in modern poetry
node.description: This program analyzes themes and subjects in mid-20th century poetry.

node.title: Some influences on modern poetry
node.description: This program discusses some influences on modern poetry, including 17th century poets like John Donne and George Herbert.
